summary: Michael Goldsmith is identified in several documents related to the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He appears in payroll and certification reports from 1977 to 1979, indicating he was an employee of the committee. Goldsmith is also mentioned in connection to CIA briefings and HSCA requests for depositions and interviews, suggesting he was involved in the committee's investigation into the JFK assassination. The documents do not specify his exact role within the HSCA, but his presence in payroll records and association with CIA-related inquiries suggest he held a professional position within the committee's staff.
significance: Michael Goldsmith's significance lies in his employment with the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA), indicating his involvement in the investigation into the JFK assassination. While the documents do not detail his specific contributions, his presence in payroll records and association with CIA-related inquiries suggest he held a professional position within the committee's staff.
